oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Aerial photograph of Jackson airport under construction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Aerial view of the Jackson airport under construction by the Works Progress Administration.

The Works Progress Administration (WPA) was a New Deal program designed to put unemployed Americans back to work. Between 1935 and its termination in 1943, the WPA employed approximately 8 million workers. In Tennessee, the WPA built roads, sewer systems, bridges, waterways, dams, viaducts, and overpasses. It also built airports in Memphis, Chattanooga, Jackson, Clarksville, Knoxville, Nashville, Bristol, and numerous other Tennessee cities.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: New Deal, 1933-1939--Tennessee; United States. Works Progress Administration
Airports; Aerial views
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee. National Guard. Photo Section, 105th
